definition: to be forgotten/to fade from memory
insipid/diluted/weak/mild/light in color/tasteless/indifferent/(variant of 氮[dan4]) nitrogen

sentences.english: This strange talk in the night faded from Slote's mind.
sentences.chinese: 斯鲁特脑子里早把这次深夜的离奇谈话淡忘了。

sentences.english: So I deliberately rigid to forget those rainy spring.
sentences.chinese: 故我刚性的去刻意淡忘那些多雨的春天。

sentences.english: I believe there is something can not be brought by time.
sentences.chinese: 原来真的有些东西是可以不被时间所淡忘的。

sentences.english: Its true origin was gradually forgotten.
But in such a joyous atmosphere, I also gradually forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 但是在这么欢悦的气氛中，我也就渐渐的淡忘了。

sentences.english: Forgotten Sailors Sleep with Eyes Open Dreaming of a Salt Water Death.
sentences.chinese: 被淡忘的水手们睁着双眼睡去，梦见那海水中的长逝。

definition: things change with the passage of time (idiom)
The issue is in the past, and the situation has changed (idiom)./It is water under the bridge.
to bury/to submerge/to pass into oblivion/to obliterate/to annihilate (physics)
to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
to fade out (cinema)/to withdraw from (politics, acting etc)/to fade from (memory)
lit. carved in bones and engraved in the heart (idiom)/fig. etched in one's memory/unforgettable
